you'll need to go breezy > dapper > edgy
well how do I upgrade to Dapper using wget?
but, with the Alternate CD, you can use apt-cdrom to add the CD, then upgrade from that
wget? that's.... ugly.  apt-get you mean?
there'll be instructions there, you'll want the "command line" instructions, obviously.
read that link, the one ubotu gave you
And that will magically install i686?  OK, I'll take your word for it.
Do I have to change anything in sources.list first?
It won't install 686, as that doesn't exist anymore in edgy.  Edgy uses a -generic kernel, for all of them.  It also has a -386 specific kernel as well.
no worries.  You've already got the kernel you want
use apt-cdrom to add the repository on the CD, then install ndiswrapper from that
There is a repository (with ndiswrapper) on the CD though, no need to sneakernet
